My question (in answer to your question) is, If God does put ideas in our minds, how would we know they were from God? There are abundant psychological explanations why things just “come to our minds”. I am always leery when someone says God gave them a particular idea, because that usually implies “so you better go along with it or you’re opposing God”. So, does God put ideas into our minds? I don’t know. But God gave us the capacity to think and to explore, so indirectly the answer is yes, in that God created us complete with a built-in mechanism to find new ideas.

The Yorkshire Ripper thought so. Sutcliffe had regularly used the services of prostitutes in Leeds and Bradford. His outbreak of violence towards them seems to have occurred because he was swindled out of money by a prostitute and her pimp. When interviewed by authorities, however, he claimed that the voice of God had sent him on a mission to kill prostitutes. It’s not uncommon for serial killers and people with mental illnesses to ascribe their actions to commandments from god. This provides them with an internal excuse for their wrongdoing. This permits them to evade a sense of responsibility for their actions.

There is a very easy way to test this. If God could put ideas in our minds, there would be no atheists, or at least very few. If God could, he put put into everyone’s mind that they must worship him. Then only the most recalcitrant Christians would ever become atheists. We can put ideas into our own minds and attribute them to God, but that is all.
